children.value: The Cloud Developer Tools environment includes the Cloud Developer Tools Dashboard to help you navigate to the installed tools.

The Dashboard is installed into your Developer Tools cluster. It is designed to give you a simple way 
to perform common Developer Tools tasks, such as:
: Navigate to the tools installed in the cluster

: Links to education to help you learn cloud-native development and deployment 
using IBM Cloud Kubernetes Service and Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud
: Links to templates that will help accelerate your project
If the Developer Tools are installed in an OpenShift cluster that includes the

, 
the Developer Tools will compliment the Cloud Pak's

. 
You can link out to these tools as an alternative pipeline technology to
Make sure you are logged into your Development cluster in a terminal.
To do so, navigate to your cluster in the

tab and
follow the instructions to login from the command line
You can test this with the following simple command.
To open the Dashboard, use the
To list the ingress endpoints for all of the installed tools, use the
This will return the ingress URLs for all of the tools installed in the Developer Tools cluster.

? Ingresses in the 'tools' namespace. Select an ingress to launch the default browser or 'Exit'.

  1) Exit
  2) argocd-server - https://grpc.argocd.mooc-one-rhos-cluster.us-east.containers.appdomain.cloud
  3) argocd-server - https://argocd.mooc-one-rhos-cluster.us-east.containers.appdomain.cloud
  4) artifactory - https://artifactory.mooc-one-rhos-cluster.us-east.containers.appdomain.cloud
  5) catalyst-dashboard - https://dashboard.mooc-one-rhos-cluster.us-east.containers.appdomain.cloud
  6) pact-broker - https://pact.mooc-one-rhos-cluster.us-east.containers.appdomain.cloud
  7) sonarqube - https://sonarqube.mooc-one-rhos-cluster.us-east.containers.appdomain.cloud
(Move up and down to reveal more choices)
  Answer: 5
You can then select the URL to open the tools dashboard directly.

In the future, the tools in the Dashboard will be linked using a single sign-on (SSO) service. 
In the meantime, the CLI includes a command to list the tools' logins.
To list the logins for all of the installed tools, use the
for each tool installed. You can use these credentials to log into each of the installed tools.

If you are using OpenShift, the Jenkins credential
will be
because the OpenShift built in Jenkins service uses IBM cloud single sign-on mechanism.
